content.question: Which of the following is an argument that the authors would make about elections in Iran, based on the passage?

choices.label: The authors would argue that the oversight role of the Guardian Council ensures that democratic norms are upheld in Iran.
The authors would argue that other branches of government are necessary to check the power of the Guardian Council.
The authors would argue that the role that the Guardian Council plays in the Iranian electoral system prevents elections in Iran from being truly competitive.
The authors would argue that the Guardian Council is a critical tool to ensure that the goals of the revolution continue to be met.

content.answer: The authors would argue that the role that the Guardian Council plays in the Iranian electoral system prevents elections in Iran from being truly competitive.

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Explain how the implications of the author's argument or perspective may affect political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
